title: subscribe​
content: </> Signal:subscribe( callback: (...any) → ()-- The callback to be invoked ) → () → ()-- A function that disconnects the callback Registers a callback to be invoked when the signal is fired.

title: fire​
content: </> Signal:fire(...: any) → () Invokes all currently subscribed callbacks. Note that, if a callback is subscribed mid-fire, it will not be invoked during that firing. Callbacks are invoked usingtask.spawn, so it's okay to yield inside a callback.
